title: Man arrested after woman was shot in Britannia Hotel
text:
News Man arrested after woman was shot in Britannia Hotel Police have arrested a 47-year-old man on suspicion of attempted murder following the shooting at the Britannia Hotel, on Dialstone Lane, Offerton, in the early hours of Tuesday morning Share Police at the Britannia Hotel in Offerton (Photo: Manchester Evening News) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A man has been arrested after a woman was shot in a hotel room in Stockport . 
Officers were called to the Britannia Hotel, on Dialstone Lane, Offerton, in the early hours of the morning on Tuesday, January 31. 
They discovered a 46-year-old woman suffering with serious abdominal injuries. 
The woman was taken to hospital where she remains in a serious, but stable condition. 
Greater Manchester Police have arrested a 47-year-old man this morning (February 2) on suspicion of attempted murder. 
He remains in police custody for questioning. Read More Driver accused of killing two young cousins in crash admits failing to stop - but denies dangerous driving 
GMP are continuing to appeal for witnesses or anyone with information to come forward, particularly any guests who were staying at the hotel. 
Chief Supt Wayne Miller, territorial commander of GMP’s Stockport borough, said: “We have one man in custody but our investigation continues as we follow a number of lines of enquiry. 
“We believe this was an isolated incident that poses no threat to the wider public however, we have increased patrols in the area and encourage anyone with concerns to approach an officer. 
“I would urge anyone who may have been staying at the hotel or was in the area at the time to contact us. Anything that you know, no matter how insignificant it seems, may prove to be vital.” 
Anyone with information should call police on 101, quoting incident number 122 of 31/01/17, or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
